column5: Hey Pam the top is only $600 that is with the poles
Rob that's awsome.
Hey Memart,  Where in Pickering did you get this and how much did it cost?  This definately looks like something I would want on my own boat.  Thanks!  Ab
Nice piece of work there Rob but that ain't no  bimini.
Can you send me email for the cost and their contact info?  [email protected]  Thanks
You are better to pm him for contact. He no longer has that boat.
I imagine the price has changed in SIX years as well....
I wonder if he liked that top at Boq.
Well with all the rain we have been having i decided to add a Bimini top to my boat and some side curtains now this year fishing the BQ in the fall will be alot warmer what do you's think     Rob
yeah, let it snow and blow at the BOQ , you will be dry and warm  till someone yells fish on...LOL  looks real good
Well, while the rest of us are out there getting wet and being lashed by waves you'll be "high and dry", nothing wrong with that.   I would drop it for trailering though.

to me it looks a little dorky but DARN nice to have and you'll be laughing at all the other suckers out there while you can sit back and relax plus you'll probably get more fishing time in which is a bonus
Bout what WD said...thats a side console right?...giving me ideas

I got first dibs for the BOQ this year, in that boat.I can see me BBQing chicken burgers under that.LOL  Buddy did a nice job bro.  Were having a lady restictch our top ,and new windows next week.  PS.Ya know POP is going to want one now eh? LOL
Nice top. One thing, if it gets windy. Oneway trolling or sailing. Be nice drifting the Picton Triangle with the MR.Heater.
Looking good Rob. Keeps you dry and warm
Now only lightning can keep you off the water! (and ice lol)

I see you want "GREEN" turning your powerboat into a sail boat.LOL. Don't let them fool you bud when they are all freezin this fall you will be warm and dry and it should keep the Canadian Airforce from eating you up in the evenins to boot.  Art  the I like it warm and dry without bug bites fisherman
Real nice!!  Looks ready for a fall muskie fish on the Ottawa r.
I want one!!!  Hopeing to have mine next year.  I'll have to face the elements this year.  Looks great.
Looks good and the benefits are obvious. Did you do it yourself, or is the picture taken at the place that installed it? I guess I am asking if it is after-market or from your Lund dealer? Jim
Thats the way to do it Rob, let me what time to meet up at McDs in Picton   ...
That's looking real good Memart
Radnine it was custom made from a little shop in Pickering
Looks good Rob!  It should keep ya dry trolling on Lake O.  Peter
I was thinking.You have yerself a cuddy, sorta speak.You and the mrs,s could have an overnighter on it now.Just add some curtians.LOL
very nice, now that you have it you will wonder how you did without it
I got a 15 feet boat and would like to put one like you with side curtain, can you email me where to buy and how much to pay. my email is   [email protected]  Thanks in advance
I will send you a email
That looks real nice!!!  ... but like others have said, on a windy day that Lund will be a Schooner!
LOL FISH ON !!!!  LOL no you get it, No you get it

Oh very nice Rob!You know ever since you became a Grandpa your tolerents for the outdoor eliments have declined.  I will envy you this fall in Quinte I expect coffee delivery from you out on the BOQ hot lunch too.  If you don't mind I will stick to my facemask yellow floater suit and hand warmers.
Can I ask how much it cost, my hubby wants one but no sides.  Ours is shot, but much the same.  Pam
